quoteText: With every experience, you alone are painting your own canvas, thought by thought, choice by choice.
There is no great genius without some touch of madness.
When the solution is simple, God is answering.
Most smiles are started by another smile.
Great indeed is the sublimity of the Creative, to which all beings owe their beginning and which permeates all heaven.
Difficulties are meant to rouse, not discourage. The human spirit is to grow strong by conflict.
Before you can inspire with emotion, you must be swamped with it yourself. Before you can move their tears, your own must flow. To convince them, you must yourself believe.
The first duty of a human being is to assume the right functional relationship to society â€” more briefly, to find your real job, and do it.
Your task is not to seek love, but merely to seek and find all the barriers within yourself that you have built against it.
